channel.title: Death
channel.description:
How do you feel about the fact that one day life is going to apply the applyDead() method to you in real life? (no, you won't re-spawn).
I think most people will be like "You live you die, so what", but deep down, I think you're scared. I'm scared.
I want to live for ever.
But nothing is for ever. Not the Earth, the solar system, the Milky Way or even the Universe.
So what's your approach on the subject?

item.title: Death
item.dc:creator: @The_Reaper_X The Reaper X
item.description:
@The_Reaper_X wrote:

There is a team of like… Idk some large number of scientists that are studying transfusion of every cell in the human body… Basically replacing every old cell with a new one so that you live forever…

Read full topic

item.title: Death
item.dc:creator: @ziplock ziplock
item.description:
@ziplock wrote:

I’m not really sure what happens, but we’re all made of energy that all (or mostly) came from the earth. (Our origins are a mystery) and one day we will die and decay and return back into the earth eventually. This is evident. What happens with our consciousness is what has me puzzled. It surely has to be composed of energy too? Does it also return back into the earth, if so, how would that get reused? It’s not like consciousness can be broken down, or if it’s even consumable energy. So I’m not sure, but honestly who is?

Read full topic

item.title: Death
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

Yes, but your personality or anything of the sort isn’t held in the energy that is transferred back into the earth. If you’re buried or cremated, you’ll become plant and insect food. That is where your energy goes.

Read full topic

item.title: Death
item.dc:creator: @Andrew_Ferguson The317Guy
item.description:
@Andrew_Ferguson wrote:

[quote=“tL, post:71, topic:407148”][quote author=Andrew Ferguson link=topic=508441.msg3694802#msg3694802 date=1312356783]

When i was younger, it has always been in my mind that you reincarnate or whatever it’s called simply to a different creature and you don’t remember a single thing from your past life.

Now i’m kinda at the idea that there’s like a separate “world” for the dead, where souls are moved. And i still believe there is heaven/hell for good/bad people on that world.

I’m curious. Your change in your idea of an afterlife and how you interpret must have been triggered by something? What makes you take on these ideas?

I was wondering the same thing about him when I saw that. I’m guessing when he grew up and saw that there is real evil in the world the heaven and hell thing made more sense. I don’t believe in a heaven or hell in a religious sense, like say following the commandments, but I do believe in a positive and negative afterlife depending on what kind of person you are.
[/quote]

But is that what you just want it to be like, or do you have some reason to actually believe it, under than thinking it’d be nice?[/quote]
I believe it because when you think about it, if a creature dies that energy and ideals of that thing have to go somewhere.

Read full topic

item.title: Death
item.dc:creator: @Rock_N_Rolla Rock N Rolla
item.description:
@Rock_N_Rolla wrote:

`SJ_:

I plan joining the services. If I want to join the infantry, I’m clearly not scared of death. When you die, you either go purgatory or heaven.

What about hell?

You will go in the army and kill people and expect to go to heaven, my dear boy you are very disillusioned.

Read full topic

item.title: Death
item.dc:creator: @Xx_Weed_Xx Xx Weed Xx
item.description:
@Xx_Weed_Xx wrote:

I’m scared to die slowly that would be horrible, But If I die in my sleep or I get shot and the bullet kills me in one hit I wouldn’t mind that much.

I think death is over-rated, Nobody wants to die but there comes a time in your life when you have to.

Read full topic

item.title: Death
item.dc:creator: @Slave_Scyth Slave Scyth
item.description:
@Slave_Scyth wrote:

[quote=“Mendorphins, post:6, topic:407148”][quote author=latifundio link=topic=508441.msg3688559#msg3688559 date=1311983066]

For the wages of sin is death; but the gift of God is eternal life through Jesus Christ our Lord.

Believe
[/quote]
I know what that means, if you sin you die, if you “believe” you live on… but what does that actually mean. I don’t believe hearsay unless it comes direct from the source. And that again is logic, not me being dis-respectful towards your beliefs.

You try to convert us, why can’t we try and convert you. Or better yet, make you see the logic.

You’ll soon regret it when you pass on and nothing happens (or you won’t because you’re gone).[/quote]I’ll regret nothing if my beliefs end up being wrong; though I believe they are. (Obviously, they’re my beliefs.)

I’d rather live for something than live for nothing.

Read full topic

item.title: Death
item.dc:creator: @SacredHeart SacredHeart
item.description:

I’m not scared to die, I want to die in my sleep or die of oldness. I’m not scared because You go to heaven and respawn there.

Read full topic

item.title: Death
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

tL:

@The Wanderer - There is no scientific evidence for an afterlife or any sort of the paranormal activity you’re talking about. Please don’t insult it by suggesting there is. People simply saying they saw this, and saw that is not evidence.

Sorry for the prolonged response, was sick and didn’t really feel like debating and such.

I did not say that there was scientific evidence that there is an afterlife, I said that there is science behind their investigations. As far as the afterlife, that is my personal opinion on the matter. I don’t expect you to feel the same way.

the EMF meter; digital thermometer; handheld and static digital video cameras, such as thermographic (or infrared) and night vision; digital audio recorder; and computer.

Those are actual scientific equipment, not tailored for paranormal activity investigation. I am sorry if you thought I was insinuating that there was scientific evidence that there was an afterlife or that paranormal activity was a fact, because that was unintended.

Read full topic

item.title: Death
item.dc:creator: @Evil1 Evil_
item.description:
@Evil1 wrote:

[quote=“tL, post:56, topic:407148”]I think the main reason I’ll be sad about dying is missing out on what people will achieve in the future. Missing out on all the potential science will bring us, just like it has done, solely, since the beginning of our existence. Not just as humans, either. Before that.

I’m not scared of being dead, I didn’t exist once before, and I’ll just cease to exist then, too. I won’t know it, because I won’t be I, I just won’t be. Of course, I’m scared of how I am actually going to die, but that is just about it.

Also, this is a nice short video on the subject: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ac33dOAgqus

@The Wanderer - There is no scientific evidence for an afterlife or any sort of the paranormal activity you’re talking about. Please don’t insult it by suggesting there is. People simply saying they saw this, and saw that is not evidence.[/quote]This.

Also, I’m honestly more afraid of someone I care for dying rather than dying myself. I’ve came to the conclusion that it’s going to happen (Hell, I’ve already seen 1 guy die, and 2 get severely injured at my workplace alone.) and I know that if it’s me that dies, I won’t know anything about it… but if it’s one of my parents/siblings then it’d actually hurt me emotionally, and that scares me more than me dying.

Read full topic

reyx7:

Quit bitching. Not like you could do a better job. We haven’t had a good president since Clinton. Bush made a bunch of shit with other countries, but even before him our economy was low. Clinton had the only upturn in profit margin since JFK. All that shit from other presidents was then thrown onto Obama, and he was told to dig his way out and clean it up.

Woot. Someone who doesn’t listen mindlessly to the general public and/or media. <3
